page.title: 14FARMS IN BURY & HOUGHTON
page.content: There are 2 dairy farms, both in Houghton, one of 500 hectares and the other of just 30 hectares. The price of their cows varies from a basic Â£1000 up to Â£5000 for a top quality animal. Both farms grow barley for their animals and store large quantities of silage for winter feed. The milk is collected daily and taken to Chichester for distribution. The two farmers help each other especially at times of intensive activity e.g. harvesting. Both farm houses are very old being built as 3 cottages in the 14th century and the other as large house in the 16th century. There are 3 other types of farms, two are fruit farms, one concentrating on apples whilst the other grows mainly soft fruit;the third is a Trout farm.
